txt.en: 'We could scarcely believe our eyes! What madness had led this beast here?'
'A mixture of awe and terror settled in our stomachs, as we slowly realized that we, too, would have to face it....'
'...I jest, I jest! The children enjoy the flourishes I add to the story, but I cannot trick seasoned adventurers.'
'In truth...'
Sagroth, Lair of Vermin
'So ends the sorry tale of Gárvadach the Coward, but *our* tale is far from done....'
'Drink deep these putrid waters!'
'Drown in these miserable depths!'
'Will you die already?!'
'Curse you, you buzzing fleas!'
'It seemed the creature had reconsidered its chances of survival against our might.'
'Stay put and accept your deaths.'
'We let it go. After all, we'd been the ones trespassing upon its home.'
'The rat had been as much a victim of the Angmarims' meddling as we had been.'
'The local fauna is fascinating, is it not?'
'The dead come forth. Won't you join them?'
'What a miserable place to die. I almost pity you.'
'One fewer insect to worry about.'
'I- I do not have time for this!'
Gárvadach defeated
You must have completed 'Discovery: Carn Dûm' by travelling to Bail Avarc in Angmar to play this instance.
'I was right! The simpletons who questioned me will rue this day!'
'Would you believe it? The absolute cowardice!'
'Submit to my will, you brute! Under my control, you will become the perfect pawn.'
'But there was no turning back -- not when that would give the snivelling worm more time to plan and act.'
'Urgh...'
'We'd prepared for everything Gárvadach might throw at us, but we had not accounted for the smell.'
'Do not attack me, you unthinking buffoon!'
'It was ghastly! I even pitied the Angmarims' poor hounds.'
'Wretched filth-spirit, how dare you?!'
'This is unexpected.'
'Where are my soldiers? Did they fail to contain you?'
'If so, they deserved whatever end you gave them.'
'I'll dispose of you myself and resume my search.'
'Are we done here? I have more important matters to attend.'
'Finally! I can get back to doing something worthwhile.'
